channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For the first time in nearly 6 decades, a Syrian president steps up to speak at the U.N.
item.description: Turning the page on decades of distance, Syria's President Ahmad al-Sharaa addressed the U.N. General Assembly, marking the first time any president f...

item.title: White House threatens layoffs -- not furloughs -- if the government shuts down
item.description: In past government shutdowns, workers have been put on temporary furloughs until funding resumes. This time, the Trump White House is looking for bigg...

item.title: Federal prosecutors near decision on whether to charge James Comey, sources say
item.description: Federal prosecutors are considering asking a grand jury to indict former FBI Director James Comey, sources say.

item.title: 'Anti-ICE' message on ammunition at Dallas shooting that killed immigration detainee
item.description: The gunman fired at an unmarked van near the detention facility, before taking his own life, officials say.

item.title: 9/24: The Daily Report
item.description: Nancy Chen reports on a deadly shooting at an ICE facility in Texas and the impact of robot umpires heading to Major League Baseball.

item.title: Colombia's president calls US attacks on alleged drug boats 'act of tyranny'
item.description: Gustavo Petro told the BBC that "there is no need to kill anyone" in efforts to crackdown on maritime drug smuggling.

item.title: America's blame game over Canada's wildfire smoke misses the point, experts say
item.description: US officials have blamed Canada for not doing enough to stop its wildfire smoke from wafting south. Climate experts say it’s not so simple.

item.title: Rihanna and A$AP Rocky welcome birth of their first daughter
item.description: The celebrity pair announced the birth of Rocki Irish Mayers on Instagram in a post that included a miniature pair of boxing gloves.

item.title: Tropical Storm Humberto forms in Atlantic. Maps show its forecast path.
item.description: Tropical Storm Humberto could potentially bring some downstream impacts to parts of the Southeast U.S. coast from Florida up to North Carolina, the Na...

item.title: 9/24: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about the deadly ICE facility shooting in Dallas; Fat Bear Week has arrived. Who will be crowned champion?

item.title: Drone activity confirmed at multiple Denmark airports
item.description: The incidents come after the country's Copenhagen airport was forced to close earlier this week due to a drone incursion.

item.title: White House tells agencies to prepare for layoffs if government shuts down
item.description: The Trump administration is raising the stakes as Congress faces a looming deadline to pass a government funding bill.

item.title: As AI advances, doomers warn the superintelligence apocalypse is nigh
item.description: AI is advancing fast, and AI doomers say humanity is at risk.

item.title: A statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands in D.C. is removed as fast as it appeared
item.description: The statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands mid-frolic wasn't the first anti-Trump artwork on the National Mall in recent months. But it was the fir...

item.title: Victim's widow files the first lawsuit after January's D.C.-area midair crash
item.description: Family members of a passenger who died in the January collision are suing American Airlines, PSA Airlines, and the federal government. It's the first ...

item.title: What to know about the shooting at a Dallas immigration facility
1 detainee killed and 2 others critically injured in Dallas ICE facility, Homeland Security says
item.description: Federal authorities say a shooter with a rifle opened fire from a roof onto a U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement location in Dallas, killing one...

item.title: Trump’s touting of an unproven autism drug surprised many, including the doctor who proposed it
